thread.section_title: Football, CFL, and NFL News | Sports | Toronto Star
thread.title: Bills rally past Titans in Motor City
thread.title_full: Bills rally past Titans in Motor City | Toronto Star

author: Teresa M. Walker
title: Bills rally past Titans in Motor City
text:
NASHVILLE—With so many key Bills sidelined by injuries, Buffalo needed someone to provide an offensive boost.
Quarterback Tyrod Taylor came through by doing a little bit of everything — even catching a pass.
Taylor threw for a TD and ran for another, rallying the Buffalo Bills to a 14-13 win over the Tennessee Titans on Sunday. It didn’t rate as another Music City Miracle, but coach Rex Ryan like what he saw in the end.
“Quarterback’s got the biggest heart,” Ryan said of Taylor. “Man, it was tough sledding, but he’s got guts, he’s got heart. He wasn’t playing great, but at the end of the day he’s the reason we won the game.”
Ryan added that teammates rallied behind the quarterback who won a three-man competition for the job.
“He’s running for touchdowns, getting back up and throwing deep balls,” linebacker Preston Brown said. “He played outstanding for us today. You want to go out and fight for a guy like that.”
Taylor ran for 76 yards as the 3-2 Bills snapped a five-game skid against Tennessee.
Stephon Gilmore intercepted Marcus Mariota’s pass with 1:32 left to seal the win.
The Titans (1-3) blew their second straight double-digit lead at home and have lost back-to-back games by a combined three points.
“We’ve got to get over that hump,” Titans coach Ken Whisenhunt said. “We’re close, but we’re not quite there.”
The Bills played without receiver Sammy Watkins (calf) and running back LeSean McCoy (hamstring) for a second straight week, with McCoy’s replacement Karlos Williams also out recovering from a concussion. They lost running back Cierre Wood in the second quarter with a knee injury.
Late in the third quarter, Taylor started running and brought the Bills back.
“We found a way to win, so struggle or not we found a way to win with the guys that we knew we were going to play with,” Taylor said.
